website_summaries.verdict: If you want an alternative to 2-piece and jaw scoops, this model's unique function may appeal to you. Otherwise, if you have large messes to pick up, consider others on our list.
pros: Rakes and picks up w/one easy step
Handles are made of durable wood
scoop and rake are made of rust-resistant metal
cons: The rake is a bit flimsy and not ideal for large, heavy piles
Handles are a bit shorter than other models (32 in
), which may require taller users to bend

customer_reviews.title: The socket where the handle attaches is held on by what looks like 4 spot welds and 3 of the 4 are ...
customer_reviews.text: This fell apart after just about one month. The socket where the handle attaches is held on by what looks like 4 spot welds and 3 of the 4 are now broken. The screws that attach the wood handle to the socket are both loose. This was a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia D. Eliason

customer_reviews.title: Most agrivating scooper ever
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, I've scooped poop many ways before but using this scoop is a total pain. I have a medium size dog with medium solid poops. Most of the poops just fall through the tines in this rake/scooper. Or they get impaled. Or you end up with grass runners (St Augustine and Zoisia grass)stuck in the tine so you back it out and knock the poop out and yell at this infuriating item. Result: 2 people tried to make it work, and it was returned. Keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: B.B.

customer_reviews.title: Not made well, flimsy and not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I expected something a little sturdier. It is light weight which isn't a bad thing but flimsy. The stick for the dustpan is broken where it is screwed on. So it's not going to last very long at all. It would've have been nice for them (the manufacturer) to have inspected before shipping out. Why don't I send it back, because if I paid for Amazon Prime for free 2 day shipping, why, if the item is defective, should I have to repackage, and drive to UPS to have it shipped back? Not lazy, it's the point. So bottom line, don't buy it, it's just not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: T. M.

customer_reviews.title: Poor design and construction
customer_reviews.text: This item is not well designed. Bought this in August and by December it had broken already. There are no screws holding the handle to the bin, it's just glued together and after a few months of daily use, it fell apart.
customer_reviews.author: Rob H

customer_reviews.title: Poorly constructed shovel.
customer_reviews.text: Have bought three of these. The first one held up for almost a year, bought a replacement and it broke in a month (the flat shovel bit broke off the handle), thought it was a fluke as the original held up well so I bought another replacement and it broke again within a month. Don't buy.
customer_reviews.author: K'nATop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: About as sturdy as chopsticks
customer_reviews.text: This scoop was delivered broken. The shipping box had no marks, so a clearly defective item was placed in he box. Even if it was not broken, the materials used to make it were junk and it would not have lasted a day. The poles are made of wood of about 1/2" in diameter covered with appears to be a plastic tube. Junk. The aluminum pieces at the business end are extremely thin. Two tines were bent and I literally used one finger to straighten them. Junk. It is garbage. Do not order.
customer_reviews.author: JPP388

customer_reviews.title: I like it but...
customer_reviews.text: I bought the large size and it works great for picking up after three large dogs. I can pick up a weeks worth of droppings in about 5 minutes. My only complaint is the handle quality is really poor and the metal is really thin gauge. I think the collector will hold up okay, but I'm expecting the handle to break. Good thing is it's a standard size and ill be able to replace it with a paint roller extension that are available at any hardware store.
customer_reviews.author: Sprocket

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love it but I can't.
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased several of these over the years and for the most part they work as needed. HOWEVER, the recent product is getting less reliable. The wooden handles are not very straight and the pressed fit connections are JUNK. Now if your picking up after one or two dogs then this may work for you especially for the price. I purchased another product from a different supplier with RIVETED connections, heavier gauge aluminum construction and the icing on the cake is that the scoop handle is slightly bent to lower the front edge of the scoop level with the ground, absolutely perfect. I'll never use anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, sturdy, can withstand wear and tear
customer_reviews.text: We find that the style with the rake on one end and the spade on the other is the best way to scoop poop from large dogs. Our original scooper just like this one lasted over 12 years, which is great considering that we left it outdoors in all kinds of weather, propped up by our trash can. So when the one handle dry-rotted, we purchased the exact same style again which has also lasted many years. We currently do not have any more doggies (sad face) but the scooper still works for any errant animal that poops in our yard.
customer_reviews.author: deejaytee

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made, Arrived bent/malformed. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.text: While it it does work well. I'm disappionted that it came in the shape it did. I use to own a scooper rake similar to this with thick, heavy rake bars. This one is very thin, and cheaply made all over. It does not feel like it will last long. I saw other comments from people noting this, but I took the gamble hoping it would be different. Check out my attached photos, mine arrived, brand new out of the box, with each "tooth" of the rake bent and malformed. I tried to bend them back, but they aren't perfect. It's a shame that a "new" product feels used and seems like it probably won't last long at all.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Not good for small dogs
customer_reviews.text: For dogs under 15lbs I'd say this isn't going to work. My parents visited with their dogs who are shih tzus and this would only pick up their tiny poops 70% of the time so if the poop were any smaller this wouldn't have worked at all. Also, you have to be willing to pick up just one to three poops at a time because even if it's not full picking up a third or fourth poop will push out previously scooped up poops. If you have a large dog like I do this works well but you're only going to get one poop at a time. Works great on grass but not on pea gravel potty stations.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Did not last 6 months, previous model with wooden handles lasted over then years. One of the metal handles broke, at the point of where the two handles are secured with a bolt & nut. I have seen better/thicker metal on my grand son's metal toys than on this item. Also the Bolt & Nut have completely rusted over where as the old one does not have any rust at all. Do not buy this.
customer_reviews.author: CRC

customer_reviews.title: to flimsy and short
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as I only needed the scooper part. First time I used it the outside tines bent and had to be straightened. Now each time I use it they bend. I am not real thrilled with this product and am going to look for a better one out there. It does scoop pretty good, but it is too short (I have to bend over too much to scoop and I am only 5'4'". I can't imagine what a taller person would have to do) and it is too flimsy. It should be made of better material that does not bend.
customer_reviews.author: Devin S

customer_reviews.title: Cheap quality. Guaranteed to break.
customer_reviews.text: This was supposed to be the same scooper I had bought previously, but forgot it when I moved. It is WAY cheaper quality. This spring mechanism is very weak. The plastic is cheap and has already broken in multiple locations. Although the size is what I was looking for, it is a complete waste of money. I purchased another one to replace it, it is smaller (I have a huge dog with huge poops) it is way better quality and the size has proven to not really matter. I’d check out :PPOGOO Non-Breakable Pet Pooper Scooper. That’s my new one.
customer_reviews.author: Mojo Ma

customer_reviews.title: Smears the poo
customer_reviews.text: When this item arrived my entire family wanted to take a turn at picking up the poo. Unfortunately the durability was not as good as I had hoped. After a few months of use one of the handles cracked and eventually broke where the two wooden handles were bolted together. The scooper on the other hand was made of durable aluminum but the tool did not work so well in thick grass. For some reason it removed part of the poo and smeared the rest into the grass. This item works better with slightly aged poo but not so hot with the fresh stuff. This unit might work better on smaller dog poo.
customer_reviews.author: Athladik

customer_reviews.title: Not great on grass
customer_reviews.text: I have used this tyoe of scooper before, in the sand at the dog park, and it was great so I bought one for my grass yard. This does not work great in grass for multiple large loads- there was always some residue left behind and some falling out. I have 3 big dogs who I clean up after immediately after they go and using this was just annoying. I bought a scooper that can be operated with one hand instead and now this just sits in the corner of the yard. Overall, not recommended for grassy areas or for multiple large pick ups.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Makes Clean Up Easy
customer_reviews.text: This Pooper Scooper was a replacement for a very similar one that didn't have the rake feauture (it should be noted the original lasted well over 20 years). The rake feature makes this the perfect pooper scooper even in tall grass. We have three dogs one under 30lbs and two over 75lbs, so I frequently am out cleaning the yard. This pooper scooper is the absolute best I've ever used. It is so much better than any I have ever tried and makes cleaning the yard a breeze. I also like the fact that it easily hoses clean. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Macy Banton

customer_reviews.title: Not bad if you're in a pinch and don't want to use a shovel to clean your dog toilet
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping that the blue handles indicated that they were made out of metal with a plastic reinforcement, but they're made out of soft wood...I think balsa would be stronger. The scoops are the thinnest Chinesium that the manufacturer could source...woe be to he who has a dog over 80lbs. I'll be surprised if this lasts longer than the plastic one this replaces. Oh, before I forget, the hinge squeaks--one of my dogs almost attacked me when I was cleaning up after them because she thought I was taunting her with a squeaky toy...
customer_reviews.author: Johana Eckerman

customer_reviews.title: Awkward angle, affordable but not useful.
customer_reviews.text: This scooper is awkward, the angle is weird and it is hard to get the poop onto the scoop - and then hard to dump the poop off of it where you want it to go. This scoop is very short. The rake rips out tons of grass with it. I used this once and went shopping for another scoop. I then found the Jibber Gear scoop and it works awesome. I appreciate that the Four Paws scoop was reasonably priced - that was nice but it didn't pay off for me.
customer_reviews.author: LoveMyDog

customer_reviews.title: You know it's something special when you are excited about ...
customer_reviews.text: You know it's something special when you are excited about a poop scooper. This thing works so well!! We foster dogs and after the winter had a ridiculous amount of poop to clean up once the snow melted. Also, because we foster dogs that are rescued from puppy mills they often come with less than solid poop. This thing picks it ALL up. The only thing I wish it had was a longer handle but if I can do an entire yard at nine months pregnant so can you! Buy this. You won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: CSoegaard

customer_reviews.title: Thought a pooper scooper is a pooper scooper, but not this one!
customer_reviews.text: This is the worse pooper scooper ever. My last one lasted 20 years, but this one less than a week. The handle broke for no reason and the 2 scoops do not meet ,so very difficult to use. I also didn't notice when I bought it that both of the "scoops" were like shovels. My last one had one shovel like "scoop' and the other was like a rake. I would mail it back, but the time I found a box to fit it I might as well buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn

customer_reviews.title: It’s for more than just poop and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: My mom actually wanted this to pick up pine cones so that she doesn’t have to bend down a million times. We’ve always used pooper scoopers for this reason. (It also is great to get mass amounts of pine straw from a raked pile into a big for disposal). The current competition is more like a grabber claw and unless you have a lot of hand strength, it isn’t comfortable or easy to use. I’m so happy I got this for mom!
customer_reviews.author: KelleaSumrak

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty! Best kind to use!
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty! I bought it to replace one that was similar but it was not as strong and durable as this one. The other one lasted for six years this one will probably outlast me. These are the best kind to use. they will pick up small and large Dog Pooh from any surface. It’s great when the grass gets a little long. 😉
customer_reviews.author: JinxieJewels

customer_reviews.title: Looks great but not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Thought this was like similar pooper scoopers I've owned in the past but this one didn't even last 4 months before the handle disconnected from the scooper. Not sure why because I never "overloaded" it. Now I have to buy another one, but it will not be like this one. I've had other scoopers last for years.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Ferriell

customer_reviews.title: Multi-purpose scooper
customer_reviews.text: I've had quite a few of these over the years, and really rely on them for picking up leaves & other yard debris when I clean out my gardens. Because the handles are wood, you just have to be careful not to squeeze the handles together too hard and not to leave it out in the rain too frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Ctdev

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: Only reason I give it 2 stars is because it lasted roughly 4 months. I got it because our grass grows fast and mangled so poop scooping is tough. The prongs kept bending they would bend back for the most part, but eventually they bent to the point of no return making it impossible to pick up anything without flinging it at yourself or just fighting and rebranding the prongs. If you have grass that grows perfectly straight. Go for it. Otherwise it's not worth it. You'll just throw it out after a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Tracie Bell

customer_reviews.title: Rivits will fail and the pan will fall off,but it's still the best.
customer_reviews.text: It's the best and most efficient scooper system out there. New, it feels loose. Within a few years the rivets will fail and the pan will separate from the handle. I used screws to hold the pan on the shaft and soon after the rivets between the shaft assembly and the pan separated. It's cheap enough to buy every few years.
customer_reviews.author: S. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last long
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two of these and they broke within the first month. Also, the smaller size made them more difficult to clean under my outside faucet. Pay a little more and get a larger scooper that is sturdier and has a wider area for cleaning which allows more water to get into it.
customer_reviews.author: AikenCockerMom

customer_reviews.title: Saves your back!
customer_reviews.text: SUPER heavy dootie!! Just like the pros use!! Just dont leave it out in the elements! The wrap on the handle will crack off and the wood handle will eventually fail. But keep it porched or in a shed then" It will last FOREVER" !!
customer_reviews.author: PapaNick

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy; easily bent out of shape
customer_reviews.text: Not Recommended. This product is made from wire that deforms too easily. It will work well in short grass, but in grass over about 2 inches, it gets hung up and tines can bend too easily as can the handle. While you can easily bend tines back in place, I use nitrile gloves to do so then dispose of them. The handle is simple flimsy plastic bonded to the wire with a grommet to hang it on a hook or nail. 3 / 5: Fit and finish 1 / 5: Materials 1 / 5: Function 1 / 5: Value 1 / 5: OVERALL
customer_reviews.author: Silver Eagle

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Design
customer_reviews.text: After my first scoop broke from a different company I thought I'd try this one. The reviews seemed great and I figured I'd have no problems. Now, in all honesty I'm on the hunt for one I've used that belongs to someone else. It's what I compare every scoop I've bought to. This seemed like a somewhat similar product. I'm not impressed. It is shaped oddly. Everything falls through the rungs and out of the sides. You have to walk slowly so as not to move things around or they will fall. I spend more time re-scooping the same pile. I'm glad it wasn't very expensive or I'd be figuring out how to return the thing.
customer_reviews.author: Chivonne M.

customer_reviews.title: Lasted for five years....  I'm satisfied....  buying another one.
customer_reviews.text: This pooper scooper does the job as required. I purchased this in September, 2013, and it lasted me more than five years, until today, when I tripped while holding it and put my weight on it, and it snapped. After five years of it working well, I'm satisfied with the product. Today, I'm purchasing a replacement, which I expect will easily last another five years.
customer_reviews.author: Critical Thinker

customer_reviews.title: Best for bigger dogs.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good thing for big turds. For small puppy turds, not great. They fall right through the rungs and it's a hassle to use when that repeatedly happens. I wait a day for the turd to dry, then use this as it's a little easier. For my small dog, I would buy a similar rake, but with small spaces. This also tends to get stuck in the southern creeping chain-like grasses. Northern states may not have that problem. So, I should have thought of that. The rake is sturdy though and if my dog was bigger, I'd probably buy this.
customer_reviews.author: An

customer_reviews.title: Great for cleaning up poo
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased. I live in the south, with two medium to large dogs, and this is just what I was needing. I had an older scoop, that worked similarly, but needed to be replaced. This is very easy to us, and rakes through the grass very easy. I would recommend letting the less than ideal poops dry for a day or so, that way it scoops easier. Those being the soft or unformed poops. No wood, so it should last for a long time, and the coating will prevent or at least limit rust.
customer_reviews.author: Auburngrad

customer_reviews.title: It's very short but sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving it 5 stars because it arrived on time and lasted a while for how tiny it is and did it'sjob. I thought it was bigger, I have a full grown 90 lb husky. I'm 5'3" and have to bend all the way over to reach the poo. It did break after several months. Considering the size of the scooper and the size of the dirty deeds, it lasted pretty darn long.
customer_reviews.author: Lady

customer_reviews.title: Product Fail
customer_reviews.text: I didn't even get one use out of this one. As soon as I started to scoop, the one of the wood handles broke in two pieces.
customer_reviews.author: RBG

customer_reviews.title: Pretty time consuming
customer_reviews.text: Pretty time consuming. You have to literally dump the poop into a garbage can with each scoop, we would rather have the flat one you scoop poop onto so you can clear the yard of multiple poops before going to the garbage can.
customer_reviews.author: ErinPinSL

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: My husband broke a few tines off our poogostick so I've been on a mission to find a replacement since you can't find them anymore. I thought I would try this one and use the pan part from the poogostick. The metal tines on this scooper are spread a smidge too far for my Frug and Frenchton turds. If you don't get them perpendicular to the tines then they tend to fall through. This scooper has a very odd angle to it. I didn't think that would be an issue but turned out it made a difference. Wish I could return it but it's been used. Dumpster it goes!
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: This scooper is amazing! I can pick up our big dogs' "land mines" with ease even it the grass is getting a little long. I one sweeping motion is all that is needed. I was even able to handle to tool one-handed while recovering from a broken wrist. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Carol A

customer_reviews.title: not so helpful on grassy surfaces
customer_reviews.text: this item is well enough made for the price and I can spray it off with the hose for clean up. However, the "shovel" part does not work very well in grass. I wish I had bought something that used a rake format instead. This design would work well on cement or sand I suspect.
customer_reviews.author: D. Beardsley

customer_reviews.title: Not too sturdy
customer_reviews.text: It gets 4 stars only because the aluminum is cheap and doesn't feel like it will hold up to much use. As a matter of fact the spade bent upon first use but was easily bent back into shape. The connections aren't solid either. For the price tho it will work until it breaks and I can't complain.
customer_reviews.author: Shopsfromeverywhere

customer_reviews.title: Piece of garbage. I do not recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Piece of garbage. Broke the first time we used it. The wood broke where the screws go through the handles. Bought two of these. Don't want to send it back due to having picked up poo already. I really don't know what to do with this? I believe my wife threw it away. One use, damn.
customer_reviews.author: rc

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I bought one 4 years ago and it broke. This will last forever through rain,snow, Texas hot summers. Amazing product and so easy to use. I will definitely purchase another one in a few years when this one needs replacing. Not to mention the price is waaaaayy better than at petsmart.
customer_reviews.author: Harlyn

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing product quality
customer_reviews.text: This is my first negative review about a product, but I want to be honest. The quality of this product is very very shoddy and cheap. I would return it but the packacking had already been discarded. The handle of the Shovel is completely bowed and as a result the shovel part cannot stand up on it's own. Also one end of the scooper was bent. I am not happy with this product and would never buy it again. You can see from the picture below how crooked the shovel handle is which makes it really awkward to work with. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: PJS

customer_reviews.title: 2nd time around wasn't as good as the first.
customer_reviews.text: had a similar item once unsure if earlier model or not. this one is made of too flimsy of material. When trying to slide under crap the handle flexes to the point where it is fighting you and flicking off with a spring like action. The tines are to flimsy also causing a springing flip that launches crap off the surface and you end up chasing it around. 1st one I owned was stiffer and stronger and much easier to complete job. Won't be buying this item again.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Butts

customer_reviews.title: Cleanup operation can't get simpler
customer_reviews.text: I have recently rescued a 50 lbs 2 yr old dog, so cleaning up the human sized landmines off my backyard became a necessity. She was not potty trained (now she is after a few weeks of basics) so it is imperative that I have a walkable area for her to foul the same grass range even through low visibility at night. The video shows my cleanup operation seconds after her rear evacuation. The ease of use is displayed. Viewer discretion advised, especially during meals.
customer_reviews.author: RescueMa

customer_reviews.title: Best Pooper Scooper
customer_reviews.text: Have used a lot of pooper scoopers, but always come back to this design. It's simple and does the job. These scoopers pick up more and can even grab in thick grass. We have two retrievers and this requires a lot of work to keep the backyard clean. Amazon is one of the few places I can find this product. I've wasted a lot of money on more expensive pooper scoopers that must have been made to use with smaller dogs. They not only fail to clean up the mess in one or two swoops, but also do not hold up for long. No pooper scooper lasts forever, but this one holds up longer and does a better job.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: It's a crappy job. . .
customer_reviews.text: . . .but somebody's gotta do it. This is the best, easiest scooper ever. The long handle is great for the distance scoop so, unless you are very tall, you don't have to bend over. The tines slide easily through the grass (or in my yard, moss) underneath the pile and scoops it up neatly. Cleaning usually entails sliding it in and out of the grass/moss several times. Easy peasy.
customer_reviews.author: Tuckendorf

customer_reviews.title: Best pooper scooper!
customer_reviews.text: We had our dog for 15 years. We bought 2 of these. The first one lasted most of the years until the handle which is wooden, dry rotted from the weather because it stayed outside in 4 seasons. The second one is still used to pick up small piles of leaves and yard waste. We dont need it for what it is intended for anymore. Our sweet girl is gone now.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Y.

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a cheap pooper scooper but you get what you pay for and I did not want to pay some of the other prices I have seen. It gets the job done. I have had it for about 2 months and one of the metal prongs on the bottom bent. Granted I think it was due to picking up pop in ice/snow in the midwest haha. But like I said, it gets the job done and it is a good scooper for the price. If you want something more sturdy that will last longer, than you might want to get something else/pay more.
customer_reviews.author: Dado Karabegovic

customer_reviews.title: No poop left behind.
customer_reviews.text: I usually dont leave or write reviews, but I gotta say I'm in LOVE WITH THIS POOPER SCOOPER. I have 6 dogs, so I have alot of poop in my yard, the rake scoops it all it doesnt get tangled or caught in the grass. The way the rake is shaped it kinda of looks like a little shovel so it hold it until you get it on the scooper. I would highly recommend. I have large dogs too.
customer_reviews.author: Mandee

customer_reviews.title: So much easier than the claw models.
customer_reviews.text: After wrestling with other claw pickup tools (which often just smear the targeted mess and usually end up breaking anyway) I decided to give this a try. Much better! The tongs slide under the load in the grass and lift it out much cleaner. You can pick up several deposits at once easily. Only minor complaint is that the rubber grip wrap is a bit loose and slides around, but no big deal.
customer_reviews.author: David Resseguie

customer_reviews.title: Every dog owner needs this
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what we needed! Long handle eliminates bending over, springs tightly close jaws so poop doesn’t escape before you want it to, teeth design doesn’t chew up the lawn. We’ve had it for almost 2 years and it’s still working like new. My 7-year-old easily uses this to help with yard work without having to actually touch poop.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as sturdy as in the past
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this type of scooper for many years. The first one I bought this year was vandalized (broken in half) by neighborhood urchins. My replacement scooper has one broken tine and 2 bent tines. They don't straighten out well and I'm pulling up a lot of grass when scooping.
customer_reviews.author: EastCoastGal

customer_reviews.title: This product is very useful and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I had bought a different tool that was more expensive and made of hard plastic. It was hard to use and to clean. So I ordered the cheaper and more simple pooper scooper -- made of metal with wooden handles. I should have looked online first as there is a bigger selection than what I could get locally. I couldn't send the 1st one back so will keep it and sell it at a garage sale next spring.
customer_reviews.author: Bev

customer_reviews.title: Works good.
customer_reviews.text: 2 dogs just shy of 100lb. Stick rake in under poo and slowly lift. If it gets caught go up and down a couple times till grass pulls free. Tines are wire and not super strong but used properly bending them is not an issue. Sometimes you need to be smarter than the tool. If you just jab it in and try to rip it up through the grass it will bent up. I even use it to pick up walnuts in the yard.
customer_reviews.author: John C.

customer_reviews.title: Works well; has survived the elements
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in October of 2014 and it is still going strong today. I use it for my two small dogs about twice a week and it has been outside through rain, snow (heavy DC snow including Snowpacolypse 2016), and it is still in good condition. Strongly recommend. Bought a similar hinged style device around the same time that fell apart shortly after buying. This gets the job done through all types of grass situation and all types of "poop" situations.
customer_reviews.author: Al B.

customer_reviews.title: Works awesome
customer_reviews.text: We have two large dogs and this rake works perfectly for clean up. The box came crushed and the item was just there one piece of paper thrown inside door what reason who knows. The rake had one bent tine so I just straightened it with a pair of plyers. The tape holding the box closed was only held on at the ends of the box. This is reason I Docked one star.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Eckerle

customer_reviews.title: Works great, long handles.
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect. My yard is mostly sand, and this scraper works much better for me than the rake-style. The pan is actually huge -- a bit too large for my needs. You won't have any issue scooping a lot of large dog waste into it. My biggest concern was that the handles would be too short. I'm a little on the tall side and I really hate when I order stuff like this and the handles are so short I have to hunch over constantly to use it (pain in the back). These handles are plenty long, thankfully.
customer_reviews.author: Lars SveenTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: One handed scooper!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best style pooper scooper out there! I have given as gifts to family and bought two for myself (back yard and front yard). No bending and doesn’t require two hands. Works for all sizes of dogs, too.
customer_reviews.author: dkkilian

customer_reviews.title: works fine but no faster than trowel
customer_reviews.text: It picks up Great Dane poop just fine but honestly wasn't any faster than just scooping the poop up with a trowel and putting it in a plastic bag. Works fine in grass or on dirt but of course if the poop is wet or sticky it's hard to get the poop off this into a bag. Also if there are leaves on the ground they get stuck on the tines.
customer_reviews.author: H. T. Minners

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I have bought this before & it works great. I leave mine outside in the rain & all, so I usually buy a new one after about 1 year because the wood handles start to deteriorate. Works great for me & I use it daily.
customer_reviews.author: KAL602

customer_reviews.title: Spring not strong enough
customer_reviews.text: The springs are barely strong enough to close it. When you put it under the pile it is not strong enough to close due to the grass under the pile. I will have to try and buy stronger springs or cut and shorten these. If my dog pooped in the street it would probably work.
customer_reviews.author: Offsure

customer_reviews.title: Love this style pooper scooper
customer_reviews.text: My dog's old pooper scooper finally fell apart after 15 years and I needed a new one. I had trouble finding one in this style and bought one of the plastic claw types from the pet store but found it very difficult to use. Glad I found this old fashioned style again - easy to use and the wood on the handles has held up very well so far.
customer_reviews.author: J9

customer_reviews.title: Best thing I have found for this unpleasant task
customer_reviews.text: Having to clean up after three large dogs (especially after a long, cold winter), this simple device works the best of anything I've ever used. It certainly works better than those spring-loaded jaw-type picker uppers, on which the handle always breaks after a certain amount of use & you end up giving yourself carpal tunnel or tendinitis from using it. This scooper has stayed in one piece for a couple of years of heavy use, & I have found that using it by putting my index finger through the middle underneath the solid plastic at the top of the handle & pulling it toward me, instead of in a sideward scooping motion, the repetitive motion injury can be minimized.
customer_reviews.author: WI Vegan

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: We haven't used this yet, just beware that ours arrived with a the pivot screw head very rusty. This will certainly impact on the durability of this product. VERY disappointed, but not the effort to return. I certainly do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: kbs121212

customer_reviews.title: I had to carry a bucket around to dump the poop
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want them because I like to pick up several piles of poop and walk over to the bucket to dump. I had to carry the scooper to the bucket each time. And I had to pay for return.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Morford

customer_reviews.title: seems flimsy and its light but it will last for many many years barring it somehow getting crushed
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of the same product. The first one still functions but it was damaged a little with the lawn mower. The first one is 5 years old and left outside all year in PA winters. It works great in grass. Though you kinda have to figure out a little technique when picking up in the grass. It works great and will last for years.
customer_reviews.author: Dom

customer_reviews.title: Yard Pick UP Is Much Easier
customer_reviews.text: We need to trim our shrubs 3 times a year here in SC. I reinforced the blade edges and they are perfect for picking up large quantities of leaves or shrub cuttings. No bending over and picking up half as much! Great for retires who need a little help. Don't have a dog so the original purpose is not the only purpose of these handy scoopers.
customer_reviews.author: SummerLoverNan

customer_reviews.title: Depends on your situation
customer_reviews.text: It’s horrible if you have a lot of weeds in your grass. The metal hooks get stuck to everything and they Bend so easy. It is easy to clean But it is not worth the purchase for me. It will be thrown away.
customer_reviews.author: Leena

customer_reviews.title: Great Working Product.
customer_reviews.text: A strong spring action makes the jaws close even through thick, wet grass enclosing the feces without grinding it into the ground. The combed jaws ensure the grass is not torn out, or clipped more than necessary, and also help to neatly entrap the feces without smearing, or dropping it. One drawback: you cannot pick up multiple piles before emptying, the design does not allow for the feces to stay inside the scoop while opening to scoop again. So you need to have your bag, can, or bucket; whatever you're using near, or with you as you patrol the yard.
customer_reviews.author: Valynn

customer_reviews.title: Good Product, Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: This works great overall. Sometimes the gap between the wires are too big and small pieces fall through. I bought mine just four months ago and it is already busted; the wires started flattening out within a few months and now this month three wires have fallen off on their own. It might have something to do with the cold weather but it's only November. The welding job must have been done poorly. It's just $10 so it's good to try I guess, but I certainly will not be ordering another one. There are better p[roducts out there. Don't only listen to the people who have had it for a few days. Everyone loves their new stuff soon after.
customer_reviews.author: a.robo

customer_reviews.title: Great Scooper
customer_reviews.text: Works in the snow and ice too. Great product. Much better than the “jaw” type scoopers. I’ve gone through 3 of those. No springs or plastic connectors to break on this bad boy. I’d highly recommend this scooper.
customer_reviews.author: B. King

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve purchased much better and much cheaper ones. It’s difficult to rake the poo. The rake is a bit too flexible. The pan has fallen off of the post. I’m pretty disappointed. I’m left with an expensive, mini, super flex rake.
customer_reviews.author: k10

customer_reviews.title: So I dont recommend this produt if you have a small dog
customer_reviews.text: Worked reasonably well in the grass, a little frustrating in the gravel, but overall worked as expected. For a while. I have 2 dogs, a 95 lb dog and a 15 lb dog. Unfortunately the tines of the rake were a little too far between and the small dogs turds often fell through the tines. So I dont recommend this produt if you have a small dog. However, the biggest reason I gave this product only 2 stars is because the tines bend easily and started breaking off with only a few months of use. Not impressed. Should have "splurged" on a higher quality scoop.
customer_reviews.author: mandarose

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't recommend
customer_reviews.text: Literally feel apart after picking up 2 turds. It broke at the screw in the middle so I had to tape the two handles with bamboo and electrical tape and now it works. 🙄🙄 I love this style of pooper-scooper though, they are really easy to use. Im a very tech, so I have used most styles out there and this is by far the best style
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tool to save your back!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool. Very easy to use and good design to pick things up in the grass. I did inadvertently bend one of the prongs when things were frozen, but it easily bent back. I plan on buying a spare.
customer_reviews.author: Wes

customer_reviews.title: its a great concept but poor materials used.
customer_reviews.text: Only had it a little while as my autistic son used it to smack weeds down.... it broke. not what it was meant for but to break against weeds.... maybe make it out of metal?
customer_reviews.author: Stock fam

customer_reviews.title: Highly effective
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I like this rake. It lifts dog waste out of the grass easily. Due to the angle of the prongs, you need to tip the scooper significantly to empty it, which makes tossing its contents next to impossible. I have had trouble with pieces of waste falling off the side- this rake will pick up one pile of labrador droppings easily, but not two- and it is worthless for diarrhea, but overall it is highly effective for removing waste from our lawn without leaving pieces behind. Our kids play on that lawn, and I feel confident that they are not stepping in pieces (or, sorry, smears) left behind.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth S.

customer_reviews.title: Made of cheap pressed wood
customer_reviews.text: Got this a few months ago. The fry few times I used it the metal “claw” bent backwards. Each time I used it it got worse. Today the handle ( which is made of pressed wood) completely snapped in half. I would not recommend this purchase as it is completely useless now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Weak
customer_reviews.text: The wire tongs are simply too weak and then bend making it very hard to scoop poop, as the bent tongs then get caught up on grass, gravel, etc. Frustrating. Hoping to find a more solidly constructed brand.
customer_reviews.author: CareyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Best I've Found
customer_reviews.text: We've had this rake for almost 4 years. We've used it once or twice a week for all that time. It is still great, I had to replace a screw this year and tape the handle because I store it outside in the summer heat and winter snow. I got the small size because we have miniature dogs. It has a longer handle which saves my back. I have just ordered another one because this one is getting old.
customer_reviews.author: MG31

customer_reviews.title: IT REALLY WORKS
customer_reviews.text: THIS ITEM REALLY WORKS, SOMEONE IN WORK SUGGESTED THIS TO ME AND I ORDERED IT ON AMAZON. WITH MY PRIME I GOT IT INCLUDING TAX, $10.48.. I HAVE 2 GERMAN SHEPHERDS AND THEY DO NOT HAVE THE HARDEST POO, BUT THIS RAKE JUST SLIDES IN THE GRASS AND PICKS IT UP. I WAS USING PLASTIC BAGS TO PICK UP THE MESS AND NOW THIS RAKE IS DOES IT SO WELL. IF ANY GETS STUCK ON THE RAKE, I JUST USE MY HOSE AND RINSE IT OFF AND ITS READY TO GO.... THE TINES ARE WELL PROPORTIONED, SO NOT TO LEAVE ANYTHING BEHIND. WONDERFUL RAKE......
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size not to big or to small
customer_reviews.text: Not to small or to big perfect size to use We have a small dog and medium dog it works great, you can pickup more then one at same Made really well very happy with the product
customer_reviews.author: Somogji

customer_reviews.title: Just okay
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a while back and figured I should right a review. I bought this because it was similar to the one my dad bought but I noticed after using it a few times that it wasn't. I am constantly having to deal with the dog crap falling off the sides because there is no sides to it. I guess it can be good for a once in a while use. The teeth get stuck in the grass and then trying to pull it out without having all the stuff I collected fall out is a pain. I probably wouldn't get again.
customer_reviews.author: collvm

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the best!
customer_reviews.text: I have been searching for this type of scooper for the past 5 years. I have tried various other scoopers and all have failed for one reason or another. This one is great! I can pick up on both long/short grass as well as various rocks here and there in the yard. Best part is after the first few uses I am now a pro. I no longer have to get my nose or face near the mess to get it cleaned up like other methods! Thanks...it really is the little things in life that make all the difference in someone's day.
customer_reviews.author: Laura, Lit-Up My Mind

customer_reviews.title: NOT meant for little dogs!
customer_reviews.text: It works well in grass, sand, and most small gravel for big dog poop. The "teeth" are way too far apart to pick up poo from little dogs. We have two chihuahuas and it doesn't even come close to picking it up. However, the poop that was left behind from the previous tenants was quickly and easily cleaned up (which makes me realize just how lazy these people were for leaving nearly 100 piles in the yard, yes I counted!). I'd happily give it more stars if I knew it would not be useful for my pets. Instead, I really want to return it and get something else. Is a used pooper scooper allowed as a return?!
customer_reviews.author: CaliMomma

customer_reviews.title: Feces have to be hard or at best not recent in order to pick up
customer_reviews.text: Works as described, however design flaw on the last two rake fingers as they are not soldered in place with any brace. If you have long grass or thick grass you will get caught. Feces have to be hard or at best not recent in order to pick up. Works but a flat nose shovel works too with the same amount of effort in my opinion. For the price and the size its good for kids.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan R

customer_reviews.title: Packaging was not dented but pan dented & thin as paper!
customer_reviews.text: Absolute garbage! The item is paper thin. My package was not dented on the outside. There was no paper or bubblewrap to orotect its delivery. I didnt expect much for the price but I did expect the pan to be straight edged. Imagine my surprise when I opened the box? Please look at pics attached. I snapped the pics right after opening the box. Absolutely unusable!
customer_reviews.author: German Shepherd Mama

customer_reviews.title: The best i have found, but could be better.
customer_reviews.text: I have used the spring clamshell type scooper for years which work wonderfully on concrete, but terrible on grass. I found this and decided to try and it works wonderfully. I get a clean scoop of the entire package every time. Th big con as other reviews have states is the strength of the wire. It bends contantly. I walk over to the sidewalk and push the wire against the concrete to straighten them back. Not a huge deal but definitely removes one star. Still works better than anything I have tried and one-handed operation is a must.
customer_reviews.author: auburntiger

customer_reviews.title: Great Design but Small model is Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: While I love this product, I have had to buy a new one every 2-3 years. As others have mentioned, some of the plastic parts are too thin and brittle. One of the connecting pieces breaks after awhile, especially of you leave it outside. Next time I think I will try reinforcing the two thin connectors with some fiberglass and epoxy. As an update, the last time I bought the larger size. The bigger one is much more substantial and will most likely last much longer. P.S. Buy the grass version. It works reasonably well on concrete, but the concrete version does not work well at all on anything but a smoother surface like concrete.
customer_reviews.author: William Weber

customer_reviews.title: No Bueno
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this thing a -5 stars I would. If you enjoy spearing dog turds in your spare time, this product is for you! It doesn't lift poo but rather smears it or pokes through it. Sometimes the turds fall through the tines and you get to try again. Think claw machine but for turds. I literally chucked it across the yard yesterday and shook my fists at the heavens.
customer_reviews.author: JEochardo

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: I wish sides were a little deeper. But that’s because I only clean the yard every couple of weeks so there is lots to get rid of. But sturdy product and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Tonia

customer_reviews.title: works well for small pick ups
customer_reviews.text: it is a lot shorter than I thought it would be. You will have to bend over unless you are 3ft tall. The specks does say it is 15" long but I had bought a taller version before for like $20 at Walmart but could not find it. works very well and feels well built.
customer_reviews.author: monkeldad

customer_reviews.title: does its job but not that sturdy
customer_reviews.text: if you have a well manicured lawn, just one or 2 small or medium dogs, this is fine. but, if you have several dogs, big and little, rough yard, taller grass, this isnt that well built. tongs or teeth on the one side, have already bent up a bit. it isnt broken, just metal is a bit flimsy. I have a rough back yard, some leaves, sticks, etc, and 4 dogs. this DOES do the job on the doo.. but longevity will be questionable. for such simple items, they seem to cost a fortune. Will build my own next time. couple of 4'x 1" dowels, single screw, and a small yard shovel on each end.. voila...
customer_reviews.author: david penna

customer_reviews.title: better than expected.
customer_reviews.text: I had my doubts, but this thing does do better than the kind that you squeeze. It doesn't rip up my grass as much. Seems to work better on dried poop. I definitely recommend the longer one so there's not as much bending. Also, the plastic around the handle is a little cheap feeling. I doubt it will last forever. I only wish they made some sort of bin to go with it. I can never find a good collection bin on wheels. With 3 giant dogs to clean up after, walking all over my giant yard with the trash can gets a little heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Davenport

customer_reviews.title: It has good capacity for poop
customer_reviews.text: It has good capacity for poop! Since I have 5 dogs, that is a big consideration! The only downside is that it is a little flimsy and I feel the need to kind of baby it along to keep from breaking it. So far, so good. One other thing. The box this came in was ridiculous. I could have turned it into a micro-house. It was almost as tall as I and I struggled to get it into the house. I was bowled over when I opened this huge box to find my little scooper!
customer_reviews.author: Poodlemania

customer_reviews.title: It's great but.. . again it breaks!
customer_reviews.text: I'm again writing a review of this product. I just ordered it again. I love the design of it. It picks up poop with no problem. Once again, tho, one of the handles has broken! When you look at the pieces, the wood is dry and rotted. I keep buying it because it works but when will Amazon step up and ask why the makers use inferior wood that has me buying this over and over?
customer_reviews.author: Nestor

customer_reviews.title: Short and a little more work than wanted.
customer_reviews.text: This rake is super short, and the way it scoops with the teeth going up a little I end up flinging poop trying to get it in the "basket" portion of the scooper. Or you just spear the poop and then have to bang it off! It does work great though for looser poops and getting the bits raked out of the grass without smoothing it around.
customer_reviews.author: AndyGirl

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Had one for years, but broke one of the tines on some ice. Bought a new product that doesn't work well in grass, so I searched on-line for this and bought it. None of the stores I visited carried this product.
customer_reviews.author: buddy123

product_meta.title: Four Paws Four Paws Wee Wee Dog Waste Pooper Scooper
product_meta.description: Size:Large| Style:Rake ScooperOur Four Paws Dog Rake Pooper Scooper is designed for easy pet clean-ups in grassy or sandy areas. Its spaced metal prongs allow for quick and easy passage through grass or sand so you don't have to get your hands messy. This dog pooper scooper also has a rubber handle for a comfortable, more controlled grip.
feature_bullets: Pooper scooper crafted for easy backyard cleanup
Metal prongs of this dog rake pooper scooper allow quick and easy pickup on grass or sand
Rubber handle comfortable and easy to grip
Four Paws pooper scooper is the simple dog cleanup solution for practical pet parents

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
